intro: Trifolium dasyphyllum subsp. uintense, commonly known as Uinta mountain clover, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which are typically bright green with a slightly hairy surface. The plant produces small, pink to reddish-purple flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Its botanical features make it an important component of alpine and subalpine ecosystems.
